intro: Aphyteia africana, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture that helps reduce water loss. Aphyteia africana is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in treating various ailments.
